page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our area covered part of the Cotswold escarpment including a section of the steep scarp slope and some of the rolling dip slope behind. It is rural with only one small village and one hamlet, together with some farms, fairly substantial in acreage. On one farm there was the bonus of a newly opened excavation of a Roman villa. The Cotswolds are limestone, which is porous, a so there is not much water lying on the top, only where the limestone has impurities. Seven Springs, lying fairly high up, is claimed as source of the Thames. Because the farms are properous woodland has been left, mainly for sporting purposes and this means that the landscape is varied. We observed life in the communities, schools and farms.
